<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 186, 171, 201]]<|/det|>
# PHYSICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 206, 332, 222]]<|/det|>
Paper 1 Multiple Choice (Core)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[732, 186, 907, 202]]<|/det|>
0625/12  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[732, 208, 907, 223]]<|/det|>
February/March 2017  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[814, 229, 907, 243]]<|/det|>
45 minutes  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 248, 544, 291]]<|/det|>
Additional Materials: Multiple Choice Answer Sheet Soft clean eraser Soft pencil (type B or HB recommended)  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 312, 388, 329]]<|/det|>
## READ THESE INSTRUCTIONS FIRST  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 343, 235, 358]]<|/det|>
Write in soft pencil.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 358, 504, 373]]<|/det|>
Do not use staples, paper clips, glue or correction fluid.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 373, 892, 402]]<|/det|>
Write your name, Centre number and candidate number on the Answer Sheet in the spaces provided unless this has been done for you.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 400, 383, 415]]<|/det|>
DO NOT WRITE IN ANY BARCODES.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 429, 892, 459]]<|/det|>
There are forty questions on this paper. Answer all questions. For each question there are four possible answers A, B, C and D.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 459, 890, 475]]<|/det|>
Choose the one you consider correct and record your choice in soft pencil on the separate Answer Sheet.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 488, 556, 504]]<|/det|>
Read the instructions on the Answer Sheet very carefully.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 518, 764, 534]]<|/det|>
Each correct answer will score one mark. A mark will not be deducted for a wrong answer.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 534, 465, 549]]<|/det|>
Any rough working should be done in this booklet.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 549, 358, 564]]<|/det|>
Electronic calculators may be used.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 564, 630, 579]]<|/det|>
Take the weight of \(1.0\mathrm{kg}\) to be \(10\mathrm{N}\) (acceleration of free fall \(= 10\mathrm{m / s}^2\) ).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 72, 99, 89]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 97, 89]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 72, 809, 89]]<|/det|> A man can either take an escalator or a lift to travel up between two floors in a hotel. <|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[180, 98, 813, 375]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 390, 920, 424]]<|/det|> The escalator takes 20 seconds to carry the man between the two floors. The useful work done against gravity is \(W\). The useful power developed is \(P\). <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 435, 760, 454]]<|/det|> The lift takes 30 seconds to carry the same man between the same two floors. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 466, 920, 500]]<|/det|> How much useful work against gravity is done by the lift, and how much useful power is developed by the lift? <|ref|>table<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 509, 510, 673]]<|/det|>
useful work
done against
gravity by lift		useful power
developed by lift
Amore than \(W\)less than \(P\)
Bmore than \(W\)\(P\)
C\(W\)less than \(P\)
D\(W\)\(P\)
<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 700, 104, 718]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 700, 653, 718]]<|/det|> The engine of a motor vehicle develops a large amount of power. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 730, 348, 748]]<|/det|> Which statement is correct? <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 758, 134, 777]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 758, 589, 777]]<|/det|> The driving force acting on the vehicle must be large. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 785, 133, 803]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 785, 510, 803]]<|/det|> The engine must have a very large volume. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 812, 133, 830]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 812, 680, 830]]<|/det|> The engine must transfer large amounts of energy each second. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 838, 133, 856]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 838, 400, 856]]<|/det|> The vehicle must be very fast.

<label>11</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 922, 106]]<|/det|>
The diagrams show two mercury barometers. The right-hand diagram shows a tube of larger diameter. There is a vacuum above the mercury in both tubes.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 116, 892, 135]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[324, 141, 662, 349]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 373, 107, 392]]<|/det|>
<label>12</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 373, 920, 407]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows four solid objects resting on a horizontal surface. The objects all have the same weight, and are drawn to the same scale.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 418, 567, 437]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[161, 444, 834, 560]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 586, 106, 605]]<|/det|>
<label>13</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 586, 763, 606]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 617, 465, 636]]<|/det|>
Why is the pressure greater on a hot day?

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 647, 134, 665]]<|/det|>
<label>A</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 647, 584, 665]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 726, 566, 744]]<|/det|>

pollen grains being hit by other pollen grains

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 518, 500, 536]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 545, 131, 562]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 545, 576, 562]]<|/det|>
water molecules being hit by other water molecules

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 571, 133, 590]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 571, 500, 590]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 72, 107, 88]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 756, 89]]<|/det|> Which statement defines the thermal capacity (heat capacity) of a solid body? <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 100, 134, 118]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 100, 717, 118]]<|/det|> the energy needed to melt the body without a change in temperature <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 127, 134, 144]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 125, 799, 144]]<|/det|> the energy needed to raise the temperature of the body by one degree Celsius <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 153, 131, 170]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 152, 912, 170]]<|/det|> the increase in the volume of the body when its temperature is raised by one degree Celsius <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 178, 133, 196]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 178, 534, 196]]<|/det|> the total amount of internal energy in the body <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 222, 107, 241]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 222, 655, 241]]<|/det|> A substance can exist in three different states: solid, liquid or gas. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 253, 633, 271]]<|/det|> Each of the two statements below describes a change of state. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[186, 285, 267, 303]]<|/det|> change 1 <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[293, 285, 920, 317]]<|/det|> Molecules move closer together but continue to travel throughout the substance. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[186, 326, 267, 344]]<|/det|> change 2 <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[293, 325, 920, 357]]<|/det|> Molecules stop travelling throughout the substance and just vibrate about fixed positions. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 369, 571, 387]]<|/det|> Which changes of state do these statements describe? <|ref|>table<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 397, 504, 529]]<|/det|>
change 1change 2
Acondensationmelting
Bcondensationsolidification
Csolidificationcondensation
Dsolidificationmelting
<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 555, 106, 573]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 555, 920, 587]]<|/det|> The diagram shows the gap between a hot surface and a cold surface. The gap can contain air, solid iron, a vacuum or liquid water. <|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[381, 598, 615, 670]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 686, 920, 719]]<|/det|> Which row shows whether heat can be transferred between the surfaces by conduction and convection? <|ref|>table<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 730, 611, 860]]<|/det|>
conductionconvection
